Graphics Manager Job at Evans Industries




        
    

        
        Evans Industries is a manufacturing company, established over 20 years ago. Our purpose is to develop high quality home and personal care products at an affordable price. We are an ISO 90001 - 2015 certified company, therefore, all our operations comply with international standards. In admiration of the high quality products, Evans Industries products have become a household name and can be found across the country.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphics Manager

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Industry: Manufacturing- Personal Care & Household Products
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Description


	Are you a creative leader with a passion for building visually powerful brands? We’re looking for a Graphics Manager to head our in-house creative team and drive the visual identity of our growing personal care and household product portfolio.


Responsibilities
In this role, you will:


	Lead and mentor a team of graphic designers
	Oversee packaging design and product mock-ups from concept to production
	Support marketing with promotional materials for campaigns and in-store activations
	Champion digital content design for social media and brand assets
	Ensure brand consistency across all touchpoints within the organization
	Work closely with Commercial, Product Development, and Marketing Teams to elevate brand presence


Requirements
What We’re Looking For:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Graphic Design, Visual Communication, Fine Arts or related field
	5–7 years of professional experience in design (FMCG/personal care experience is a strong plus)
	2–3 years in a supervisory or team lead role
	Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign)
	Strong understanding of packaging design & print production
	Excellent sense of branding, typography, layout and visual storytelling


What You’ll Bring


	Creativity with strategic thinking
	Strong eye for design and detail
	Ability to manage multiple projects at once
	Leadership, ownership, and collaborative spirit
	Passion for translating ideas into powerful visuals


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Portfolio to: info@evansng.com ; bless.graida@evansng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Fibre Field Technician",
  "description": "Lington &amp; Bernie Consulting Limited was established on October 8, 1999 to provide efficient and qualitative consulting services to the oil and gas industry as well as banks and financial institutions in the areas of human resources placement and management, human resources consulting services, tax administration and payroll services as well as oil and gas fiscal and contractual terms advisory services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fibre Field Technician
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a skilled Fiber Field Technician who will be responsible for the installation, splicing, testing, maintenance, and repair of fiber optic cables and related infrastructure.
	The role involves supporting network rollouts, troubleshooting connectivity issues, ensuring service quality, and providing on-site technical support to customers and internal teams.


Responsibilities


	Install, splice, terminate, and test fiber optic cables for backbone, access, and last-mile connections.
	Perform aerial and underground fiber installation in compliance with safety standards.
	Carry out customer premises equipment (CPE) installation and ensure proper connectivity.
	Diagnose and repair fiber cuts, faults, and service interruptions.
	Conduct OTDR, power meter, and light source testing for link verification.
	Provide timely resolution of service-affecting issues and escalate complex faults when necessary.
	Support NOC and optimization teams in maintaining network uptime and performance.
	Assist in planned maintenance activities such as link upgrades, re-routing, and preventive maintenance.
	Document and update network records, splicing diagrams, and test results.
	Interact with customers during installation and fault resolution, ensuring professionalism and customer satisfaction.
	Educate customers on proper use and care of installed services.
	Adhere to company safety standards and regulatory requirements during field operations.
	Ensure proper use of tools, vehicles, and protective equipment.


Requirements


	B.Sc. in Telecommunications, Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.
	Minimum 2 &ndash; 3 years of hands-on experience in fiber optic installation and maintenance (preferably in an ISP or telecom environment).
	Key Competencies:
	Proficiency with OTDR, power meters, splicing machines, and other fiber testing tools.
